name: Odd Even Linked List
title: Odd Even Linked List
content:
Given the head of a singly linked list, group all the nodes with odd indices together followed by the nodes with even indices, and return the reordered list.

The first node is considered odd, and the second node is even, and so on.

Note that the relative order inside both the even and odd groups should remain as it was in the input.

You must solve the problem in O(1) extra space complexity and O(n) time complexity.

 

Example 1:

Input: head = [1,2,3,4,5]
Output: [1,3,5,2,4]

Example 2:

Input: head = [2,1,3,5,6,4,7]
Output: [2,3,6,7,1,5,4]

 

Constraints:

  • The number of nodes in the linked list is in the range [0, 104].
  • -106 <= Node.val <= 106

discussion_posts.name: JigsawCorp
discussion_posts.content: Am I the only one who thinks this question is badly worded? "Please note here we are talking about the node number and not the value in the nodes.". This sentence doesn\'t make sense. It would be better worded as "Please note here we are talking about the node index and not the value in the nodes."

discussion_posts.name: KALILO2020
discussion_posts.content: Please don\'t post solutions in the discussion tab.

discussion_posts.name: sakib9049
discussion_posts.content: i think it is good decision to separate discuss and solution

discussion_posts.name: wangrx0928
discussion_posts.content:
The odd indices means the first, third, 5th, 7th..in the list.
It is not related to what number it is.

For example:
input:  2 4 2 4 2 4 2 
expected: 2 2 2 2 4 4 4

discussion_posts.name: zONURz
discussion_posts.content: Please stop posting solutions in the DISCUSSION tab lol

discussion_posts.name: ayushanand18
discussion_posts.content: This was a classic yet fundamental question. For those who have a sound understanding of what linked lists are and how they work should have come up with a solution almost instantaneously. \nThis question could have been made trickier if instead of the node number being the deciding factor, the node value be the deciding factor. Thanks!

discussion_posts.name: Minamikaze392
discussion_posts.content: Why are so many ppl today posting solutions in the discussion board?

discussion_posts.name: Sleatt
discussion_posts.content: There seems to be a lot of confusion regarding this question. \nThe question does not care about the VALUE inside the node (head.val), only the INDEX.
